message: I'll start off w/: 1) Change volume w/o the sound notification: Hold down the Shift while changing volume. 2) #To turn screen off w/o sleeping the system: Ctrl + Shift + Eject. 3) #Forward Deletion: Fn + Delete or Ctrl + D
AppleScript it is quick and works
winzip for mac. you can quick view the contents of compressed files
cmd + shift + 4 = screen grab with selection. then try holding shift or alt or both while selecting

here's shell script to show/hide hidden files in finder

# check if hidden files are visible and store result in a variable
isVisible=`defaults read com.apple.finder AppleShowAllFiles`

# toggle visibility based on variables value
if [ "$isVisible" = FALSE ]
then
defaults write com.apple.finder AppleShowAllFiles TRUE
else
defaults write com.apple.finder AppleShowAllFiles FALSE
fi

# force changes by restarting Finder
killall Finder

1) Restart holding the 'T' key to boot into target disk mode. This allows you to share your HD with another mac over firewire. 2) Quickly see the working directory and navigate it in the finder by holding command and clicking the file/folder at the top of the window. 3) Hold the SHIFT key and minimize a window. (not useful what-so-ever, but kinda sweet)
I just like that ctrl + option +  + 8 = inverted colors.  Oh... and that shift + opiton + k = 
Most used: cmd + m for minimize and for maximize hold cmd slide finger to option than release.
Hold Shift during a restart to Safe Boot.
This isn't a trick but I going off safeboot applejack the software has saved me a couple of times great piece to install
On iTunes, to check / uncheck all songs in a playlist all at once: Cmd + click on a check box & to check for updates on the app page: Cmd + R.
On Photo Booth, to disable countdown: hold down Option. To disable flash: hold down Shift.
You can do a ton of cool things with Onyx http://www.macupdate.com/app/mac/11582/onyx
